ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course greatly improves my writing skills and enables me to develop a more comprehensive understanding of truth and facts.

I learned about the evolution of truth and epistemology. Funnily enough, we never are able to fully answer the question of how to tell the truth, however we learn different techniques on how to best weed out falsehoods and uphold truth. Learned how to write essays - strong emphasis on writing a thesis, and strong topic sentences. Our biggest project was the 10 page research paper which was a wonderful experience due to Prof. Rileys guidance and workshops with yale librarians.
My ability to write a paper compacted transformed. I am much more confident!

This class definitely helped me better my writing abilities through both precision and specificity. Professor Riley is an incredible instructor and gives numerous opportunities for active participation with the material.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's a well-organized and interesting class. The professor is amazing. I learn a lot in every class. I really cannot think of ways to make this course even better.

Strengths: Professor Riley. One of the best professors at Yale in my opinion. Incredibly engaging, and pushes you to do your best and step out of your comfort zone. No weaknesses. This was my favorite class at Yale so far

There was a very good outline for the class and the syllabus was very clear with deadlines and readings. The material was interesting, while at some times long, but I did all come together very nicely with themes of the class. The essay writing process was spaced out and enough time and help was offered to truly succeed.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you strive to improve your writing skills and are interested in the topic Telling the Truth.

YES!!!! Awesome class to explore important concepts such as truth and democracy which is incredibly topical. The books we read were awesome and I have been recommending them to friends and family. The beauty of this class is that it exposes you to the awesome English program at Yale, while also learning interesting topics. If you need a writing credit, or even are just interested in epistemology - take this class!!!
Yes, especially a first year looking to establish a solid writing foundation.
This is a great course to take if you are interested in political science, English, and truth. Professor Riley is an incredible resource and any class you can take with her, DO IT!

Coming from the perspective of someone who doesn't like writing very much: this course is a good choice to fulfill your writing credit. There wasn't any mind-blowing insights or anything like that but Prof. Riley is an excellent teacher and the grading is very fair.
